intro: Miconia tonduzii var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous tiny seeds.
